title: Neutral outsider
data:
The **neutral outsider** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and is represented by the [double quotation mark](/wiki/Double_quotation_mark "Double quotation mark") glyph (").

The monster class consists of [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned spiritual beings that often have [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem")-like forms, and come in two main types: the metallic [Rilmani](/wiki/Rilmani "Rilmani"), and the reflective [Kamerel](/wiki/Kamerel "Kamerel"). All of the outsiders are designated internally by the macro **S\_NEU\_OUTSIDER**.

## List of Kamerel

The Kamerel are a group of neutral outsiders associated with various kinds of reflection and reflective surfaces, and are defined by `is_kamerel` in mondata.h. Befitting their nature, all Kamerel are naturally [reflective](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). [Spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") Kamerel are [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") [mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") of varying material, which counteract the increases in spell failure rates induced by [the Outlands and Outlands Rings](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Outlands "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands").

Kamerel often spawn as [Witnesses of the Great Fracture](/wiki/Witness "Witness").

The types of Kamerel are:

- " [Amm Kamerel](/wiki/Amm_Kamerel "Amm Kamerel") (ordinary glass mirrors), which have four subtypes: warrior, fighter driver, wizard driver and wizard leaders. The former pair will always generate cancelled and unable to cast [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), so that they instead rely on their [mirrorblades](/wiki/Mirrorblade "Mirrorblade"), which deal the higher of two damage values as its *base* damage: the *full* weapon damage of your current weapon (including its enchantment, material bonuses, and beatitude bonuses), or the normal base damage of the mirrorblade.
- " [Hudor Kamerel](/wiki/Hudor_Kamerel "Hudor Kamerel") (reflections in water)
- " [Sharab Kamerel](/wiki/Sharab_Kamerel "Sharab Kamerel") (reflections in air, i.e. mirages)
- " [Ara Kamerel](/wiki/Ara_Kamerel "Ara Kamerel") (metaphorical spiritual reflection, and also gold mirrors)

## List of Rilmani

The Rilmani are a group of neutral outsiders associated with the seven alchemical metals, and are defined by `is_rilmani` in mondata.h. Each of the Rilmani have a form based on a particular element, with starting equipment of the corresponding [material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)").

The types of Rilmani are:

- " [Plumach Rilmani](/wiki/Plumach_Rilmani "Plumach Rilmani") (Lead)

- " [Ferrumach Rilmani](/wiki/Ferrumach_Rilmani "Ferrumach Rilmani") ([Iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"))

- " [Cuprilach Rilmani](/wiki/Cuprilach_Rilmani "Cuprilach Rilmani") ([Copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") and bronze)

- " [Stannumach Rilmani](/wiki/Stannumach_Rilmani "Stannumach Rilmani") (Tin)

- " [Argenach Rilmani](/wiki/Argenach_Rilmani "Argenach Rilmani") ([Silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"))

- " [Aurumach Rilmani](/wiki/Aurumach_Rilmani "Aurumach Rilmani") ([gold](/wiki/Gold_\(material\) "Gold (material)"))

- [Unique](/wiki/Unique_monster "Unique monster") Rilmani:

  - " [Center of All](/wiki/Center_of_All "Center of All")
  - " [Adamach](/wiki/Adamach "Adamach") (Adamantine)

- Deferred monsters:

  - " [Hydrargyrumach Rilmani](/wiki/Hydrargyrumach_Rilmani "Hydrargyrumach Rilmani") (mercury sulfide)

    - " [mercurial essence](/wiki/Mercurial_essence "Mercurial essence") (Mercury)
    - " [brimstone essence](/wiki/Brimstone_essence "Brimstone essence") (Sulfur)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Neutral outsider

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The neutral outsider is a monster class that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack, and is represented by the double quotation mark glyph (").

The monster class consists of neutral-aligned spiritual beings that often have golem-like forms, and come in two main types: the metallic Rilmani, and the reflective Kamerel. All of the outsiders are designated internally by the macro S_NEU_OUTSIDER.

List of Kamerel

The Kamerel are a group of neutral outsiders associated with various kinds of reflection and reflective surfaces, and are defined by is_kamerel in mondata.h. Befitting their nature, all Kamerel are naturally reflective. Spellcasting Kamerel are always generated with mirrors of varying material, which counteract the increases in spell failure rates induced by the Outlands and Outlands Rings.

Kamerel often spawn as Witnesses of the Great Fracture.

The types of Kamerel are:

  • " Amm Kamerel (ordinary glass mirrors), which have four subtypes: warrior, fighter driver, wizard driver and wizard leaders. The former pair will always generate cancelled and unable to cast monster spells, so that they instead rely on their mirrorblades, which deal the higher of two damage values as its base damage: the full weapon damage of your current weapon (including its enchantment, material bonuses, and beatitude bonuses), or the normal base damage of the mirrorblade.
  • " Hudor Kamerel (reflections in water)
  • " Sharab Kamerel (reflections in air, i.e. mirages)
  • " Ara Kamerel (metaphorical spiritual reflection, and also gold mirrors)

List of Rilmani

The Rilmani are a group of neutral outsiders associated with the seven alchemical metals, and are defined by is_rilmani in mondata.h. Each of the Rilmani have a form based on a particular element, with starting equipment of the corresponding material.

The types of Rilmani are:

  • " Plumach Rilmani (Lead)
  • " Ferrumach Rilmani (Iron)
  • " Cuprilach Rilmani (Copper and bronze)
  • " Stannumach Rilmani (Tin)
  • " Argenach Rilmani (Silver)
  • " Aurumach Rilmani (gold)
  • Unique Rilmani:
    • " Center of All
    • " Adamach (Adamantine)
  • Deferred monsters:
    • " Hydrargyrumach Rilmani (mercury sulfide)
      • " mercurial essence (Mercury)
      • " brimstone essence (Sulfur)

The monster class consists of [[neutral]]-aligned spiritual beings that often have [[golem]]-like forms, and come in two main types: the metallic [[Rilmani]], and the reflective [[Kamerel]]. All of the outsiders are designated internally by the macro '''S_NEU_OUTSIDER'''. ==List of Kamerel== The Kamerel are a group of neutral outsiders associated with various kinds of reflection and reflective surfaces, and are defined by is_kamerel in mondata.h. Befitting their nature, all Kamerel are naturally [[reflection|reflective]]. [[Spellcasting]] Kamerel are [[Monster starting inventory|always generated with]] [[mirror]]s of varying material, which counteract the increases in spell failure rates induced by [[User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands|the Outlands and Outlands Rings]]. Kamerel often spawn as [[Witness|Witnesses of the Great Fracture]]. The types of Kamerel are: * {{gray|"}} [[Amm Kamerel]] (ordinary glass mirrors), which have four subtypes: warrior, fighter driver, wizard driver and wizard leaders. The former pair will always generate cancelled and unable to cast [[monster spell]]s, so that they instead rely on their [[mirrorblade]]s, which deal the higher of two damage values as its ''base'' damage: the ''full'' weapon damage of your current weapon (including its enchantment, material bonuses, and beatitude bonuses), or the normal base damage of the mirrorblade. * {{blue|"}} [[Hudor Kamerel]] (reflections in water) * {{brown|"}} [[Sharab Kamerel]] (reflections in air, i.e. mirages) * {{yellow|"}} [[Ara Kamerel]] (metaphorical spiritual reflection, and also gold mirrors) ==List of Rilmani== The Rilmani are a group of neutral outsiders associated with the seven alchemical metals, and are defined by is_rilmani in mondata.h. Each of the Rilmani have a form based on a particular element, with starting equipment of the corresponding [[Object materials (dNetHack)|material]]. The types of Rilmani are: * {{black|"}} [[Plumach Rilmani]] (Lead) * {{red|"}} [[Ferrumach Rilmani]] ([[Iron]]) * {{orange|"}} [[Cuprilach Rilmani]] ([[Copper]] and bronze) * {{white|"}} [[Stannumach Rilmani]] (Tin) * {{white|"}} [[Argenach Rilmani]] ([[Silver]]) * {{yellow|"}} [[Aurumach Rilmani]] ([[Gold (material)|gold]]) * [[Unique monster|Unique]] Rilmani: ** {{magenta|"}} [[Center of All]] ** {{magenta|"}} [[Adamach]] (Adamantine) * Deferred monsters: ** {{orange|"}} [[Hydrargyrumach Rilmani]] (mercury sulfide) *** {{gray|"}} [[mercurial essence]] (Mercury) *** {{yellow|"}} [[brimstone essence]] (Sulfur) {{variant-343}} [[Category:dNetHack monster classes]] [[Category:notdNetHack monster classes]]
